ATTENTION: For people who are crashing on the Capcom screen you have to Uninstall the following things: The Razer "Nostromo" drivers and anything that shows up in the Steam Big picture controller settings, I had Drivers named "Jumi" which made my game crash, Motionjoy drivers could also cause a crash if you arent using the Xbox 360 emulation. Also you may have to put a driver named "dinput8.dll" in the Win32 folder (Where the .EXE is located) for the xbox controller to work without the game crashing. Hope this helps! As I said please let others know if the tracker list sent by me is working then share it with others

This is a popular game.  This game is very new.  It was uploaded yesterday.  Demand > supply.  Seeders WILL be less than leechers.  But 90% of people who have downloaded ARE seeding.  Whining "omg seeed pls" won't do any good, because almost everyone IS seeding!  

With a seed/peer ratio like this, you should be able to average about 200kB/s, depending on your available bandwidth.  That means you should be able to download this entire game in about 12 hours.   If not, make sure your torrent app's ports are forwarded to your router properly.  If you haven't forwarded your ports, then you won't be connectable, and you will get TERRIBLE download speeds because seeders won't be able to connect to you.  

If you don't know what port-forwarding is, google it.

guys, please, your problem is not because of a lack of seeders.  whining "omg seed pls seeeed" isn't going to do anything.  even if there WAS anyone else to seed, they aren't going to see some whiny plea on this comment board and think "oh, maybe i WILL seed!".  But there are NOT any other secret hidden seeders anywhere.  THIS IS IT!   I can guarantee you that 90% of people that have downloaded this game are seeding it!

The simple fact is that this is an incredibly popular game, and it was only released two days ago.  Supply cannot keep up with demand.

IF you are getting terrible download speeds, WAIT!  THEY WILL CHANGE!  you should AVERAGE about 200kB/s.  Spiking up to 500kB/s, and then plummeting down to 0kB/s.  But as long as your ports are forwarded properly and you are connectable, it WILL finish in less than 24 hours!

I don't know why you guys are having such problems with downloading.  I finished downloading in 12hr11m, with an average speed of 221kB/s.

Here's two things that can make your download speed absolute CRAP:

1) Make sure you have your torrent app's ports forwarded to your router.  If not, you will only be able to connect to peers yourself, and they won't be able to connect to you.  If your port isn't forwarded, you'll get as little as 10% of the avg dl speed you could get.

2) do NOT upload/seed at FULL SPEED!  Most of you are probably using ADSL, and if you are uploading at full speed, your download speed will plummet to near-nothing.  Upload at 50%-75% of your maximum possible upload bandwidth to allow download bandwidth through.  This is a known limitation of asynchronous DSL.
@raj.max - Do a force-recheck of your completed torrent.  An error that says "the source file is corrupted" is self-explanatory; the source file is corrupted.

@ lutakflint12  AND ANYONE HAVING STUTTER PROBLEMS (small 1-3 sec screen freeze every minute or so):


Try opening DMC game folderDevilGameConfigDefaultEngine.ini and look for this "MaxSmoothedFrameRate=". It's at 1000 default, just change it to 60 (if you have a 60 refresh rate) and save the file). 

After that try starting the game (maybe disable HD shadows and antialising as well).

Remember to back up that file 1st :D. Also if this works for you and fixes it completely pls let me know it worked.
Oh and turn Vsync on in game if just the previous thing doesn't work.

FOR STUTTERING/Mini-freezes:

DMC game folder/DevilGame/Config/DefaultEngine.ini 

Change "MaxSmoothedFrameRate=1000" to "MaxSmoothedFrameRate=60".

In game HD Textures, HD Anti-aliasing, HD Shadows and VSYNC turned ON (ignore previous post, with it off it's still doing it).

Also if it still doesn't work: Nvidia control panel, manage 3d settings, only for DMC chance the Maximum Pre-rendered frames to 1 (remember to click apply).

Alright, regarding my previous comment, my problem is solved. The white screen of nothing turned out to be a strange glitch where the game actually skipped a group of demons, which you supposed to fight first, and straight to a jumping sequence. That skip caused the level to not finish properly after the jumping sequence. Anyway, I solved it by restarting the whole chapter or level (not just from the checkpoint), and the second time round, the demons showed up before the jumping sequence, so I figured out the first level run had a glitch. Hope this helps someone out there.

It won't run. It tells me that I need to be running Steam. Installed as per directions. No good. I tried opening it with Steam running, nothing happens. Not even an error. Tried loading the .exe in Steam itself. It says it can't play a modded game. I uninstalled Steam and we're back to "Steam needs to be running for you to play this game." Info on a fix?

Never mind. I didn't realize that on Windows 8, even as an Admin, you don't have unlocked rights/ownership to folders. You have to edit the registry to enable "Take Ownership" to appear in your context menu. When you move the files to the game folder, it only looks like it's being copied over, and even shows a percentage and overwrite dialog, but it doesn't actually do anything. Odds are, if you get the Steam error, you either don't have ownership to the files, or you forgot to copy the crack files to the folder.
